items.name: Weapon Proficiency
items.entry: You gain proficiency in Simple finesse weapons. Additionally, you gain proficiency in one of the following:
simple melee weapons
simple ranged weapons

items.name: Weapon Mastery
items.entry: Gain 2 Masteries. Whenever you gain a level you can swap one of these masteries with a different mastery.

items.name: Repeatable
items.entry: You can take this feat more than once.

feat.name: Sentinel
entries: You gain the following benefits:

items.name: Guardian
items.entry: Immediately after a creature within your reach takes the Disengage action or hits a target other than you with an attack, you can make an Opportunity Attack against that creature.

items.name: Halt
items.entry: When you hit a creature with an Opportunity Attack, their speed becomes 0 until the start of their next turn.

feat.name: Sharpshooter
entries: You gain the following benefits:

items.name: Shrapnel
items.entry: When you make an attack with a ranged weapon against a creature that is behind cover and hit, deal extra damage equal to your proficiency bonus.

items.name: Firing in Melee
items.entry: Being within reach of an enemy doesn't impose Disadvantage on your ranged Attack Rolls with Weapons.

items.name: Long Shots
items.entry: Attacking at Long Range doesn't impose Disadvantage on your ranged Attack Rolls with Weapons.

feat.name: Great Weapon Master
entries: You gain the following benefits:

items.name: Hew
items.entry: Immediately after you score a Critical Hit with a Melee Weapon or reduce a creature to 0 Hit Points with one, you can make one attack with the same weapon as a Bonus Action.

items.name: Heavy Hits
items.entry: When you hit with a two-handed Weapon as part of the attack action, you can deal extra damage of the weapon's damage type equal to your proficiency bonus.

feat.name: Polearm Master
entries: You gain the following benefits:

items.name: Pole Strike
items.entry: Immediately after you take the Attack Action and attack with a Weapon that has the Reach property and the two-handed or versatile property, you can use a Bonus Action to make a Melee Attack with the opposite end of the Weapon. The weapon's damage die for this attack is a d4, and it deals Bludgeoning Damage.

items.name: Reactive Strike
items.entry: While you are holding a Weapon that has the Reach property and the two-handed or versatile property, you can make an attack as a reaction against a creature that enters the Reach you have with that Weapon.

feat.name: Heavy Armor Master
entries: You gain the following benefits:

items.name: Damage Reduction
items.entry: While you're wearing Heavy Armor, reduce any damage dealt to you by weapon attacks by an amount equal to your proficiency bonus.

feat.name: Mind Breaker
entries: You gain the following benefits.

items.name: Shatter Mind
items.entry: If you force a creature to make a saving throw to maintain concentration by damaging them with a weapon attack and they fail by 5 or more, the attack becomes a crit. If it was already a crit, then the next time you force them to make a saving throw to maintain concentration within the next minute they have disadvantage.

items.name: Guard Mind
items.entry: Before you make an intelligence, charisma or wisdom saving throw, you can choose to add your proficiency bonus to the roll. If you do and fail, you cannot use this again until you finish a long rest.

feat.name: Mage Slayer
entries: You gain the following benefits.

items.name: Break Concentration
items.entry: Once per turn before a creature would succeed or fail on a saving throw to maintain concentration that you caused them to make, you can subtract your proficiency bonus from their saving throw.

items.name: Spellguard
items.entry: If someone you can touch would fail a saving throw against a spell, you can add twice your proficiency bonus potentially changing it into a success. Once you use this benefit, you can't use it again until you finish a Long or Short Rest.

feat.name: Spell Sniper
entries: You gain the following benefits.

items.name: Shrapnel
items.entry: When you hit a creature that is behind cover with a spell attack, deal extra damage equal to your proficiency bonus.

items.name: Casting in Melee
items.entry: Being within reach of an enemy doesn't impose Disadvantage on your Attack Rolls with Spells.

items.name: Increased Range
items.entry: When you cast a Spell that has a range of at least 10 feet and that requires you to make an Attack Roll, you can increase the Spell's range by 60 feet.

feat.name: Athlete
entries: You gain the following benefits:

items.name: Climb Speed
items.entry: You have a Climb Speed equal to your Speed

items.name: Hop Up
items.entry: When you are Prone, getting up only spends 5ft of movement

items.name: Jumping
items.entry: Once at any time you can add 5 times your proficiency bonus to your jump distance until the start of your next turn. You regain this ability on a short or long rest.

feat.name: Crossbow Expert
entries: You gain the following benefits:

items.name: Ignore Loading
items.entry: You ignore the Loading property of the Hand Crossbow, Heavy Crossbow, and Crossbow (all called crossbows elsewhere in this feat).

items.name: Firing in Melee
items.entry: Being within reach of an enemy doesn't impose Disadvantage on your Attack Rolls with crossbows.

items.name: Dual Wielding
items.entry: When you make the extra attack of the Light weapon property, you can add your Ability Modifier to the damage if that attack is with a crossbow and you aren't already adding that modifier to the damage

feat.name: Dual Wielder
entries: You gain the following benefits.

items.name: Enhanced Dual Wielding
items.entry: Choose one of your hands. Weapons have the light property while they are being held by only that hand.

items.name: Dual Mastery
items.entry: Choose a light weapon. Masteries that can be used with the chosen weapon can be used with any weapon that is only being held by the chosen hand. If you chose a melee weapon, this only affects melee weapons. If you chose a ranged weapon, this only affects ranged weapons. You can change the weapon whenever you gain a level.

items.name: Repeatable
items.entry: You can take this feat one additional time, but you must choose a different hand for Enhanced Dual Wielding.

feat.name: Titan Grip
entries: You master fighting with a two-handed weapon in one hand, gaining the following benefits:

items.name: One-Hand Grip
items.entry: Choose one of your hands. Treat Versatile and Two-handed melee weapons that you are holding with only the chosen hand as if they are being held by two hands (the same hand twice).

items.name: Titan Mastery
items.entry: Choose a melee weapon that does not have the light or two-handed property. Masteries that can be used with the chosen weapon can be used with any weapon that is being held by the chosen hand. If you chose a versatile weapon, this only applies to masteries that can be used with that weapon one-handed. You can change the weapon whenever you gain a level.

items.name: Repeatable
items.entry: You can take this feat one additional time, but you must choose a different hand for one-hand grip

items.name: Proficiency
items.entry: You gain proficiency in one skill of your choice.

items.name: Expertise
items.entry: Gain expertise in a skill offered by the class that granted you this feat. If you were proficient in that skill, gain proficiency in a skill of your choice.

feat.name: Weapon Master
entries: You have practiced extensively with a variety of weapons, gaining the following benefits:

items.name: Proficiency
items.entry: You gain proficiency in simple weapons and martial weapons.

items.name: Weapon Mastery
items.entry: Gain 2 Masteries. Whenever you gain a level you can swap one of these masteries with a different mastery.

items.name: Repeatable
items.entry: You can take this feat more than once.

feat.name: Elemental Adept
entries: You gain the following benefits:

items.name: Chosen Element
items.entry: When you gain this feat, choose one of the following damage types: acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder. You gain tolerance to that damage type.

items.name: Elemental Burst
items.entry: You can use elemental burst at any time. If you do, until the start of your next turn whenever you deal damage of the type you chose and it is reduced, you create a burst of elemental damage. Creatures within 5ft of the target must make a dexterity saving throw against your Spell Save DC. On a failure, they take the damage that was prevented. This feature does not affect damage that was dealt by this feature. You can use this a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus and regain all uses on a long rest.

items.name: Repeatable
items.entry: You can take this feat more than once, but you must choose a different element each time for Chosen Element.

feat.name: Counterstriker
entries: You gain the following beneifits:

items.name: Patient
items.entry: You can set two triggers when you hold your action or bonus action.

items.name: Counter Damage
items.entry: If you reduce damage using an instaneous reaction, reduce by twice as much.

feat.name: Poisoner
entries: This feat is replaced by the Chemical Adept feat

feat.name: War Caster
entries: You gain the following benefits

items.name: Damage Reduction
items.entry: When you take damage from a weapon attack you can reduce the damage by an amount equal to the level of a spell you're concentrating on. If you do, you cannot do so again until the start of your next turn.

items.name: Opportunity Spell
items.entry: When a creature provokes an Opportunity Attack from you, you can use your Reaction to cast a Spell at the creature, rather than making an Opportunity Attack. The Spell must have a casting time of one Action and must target only that creature.

feat.name: Mad Mage
entries: You gain the following benefits

items.name: Spread Madness
items.entry: Whenever you fail a saving throw to maintain concentration, enemies within 5 ft of your must succeed on a constitution saving throw or take psychic damage equal to the level of the spell you're concentrating on plus your proficiency bonus.

items.name: Mad Magecraft
items.entry: Choose a number of spells you know equal to your proficiency bonus. For each of those spells, choose a damage type. Whenever you cast one of those spells, you can change its damage type to the chosen damage type. You can change one of the spells you chose (and its corresponding damage type) whenever you gain a level in the class that granted you this feat.

feat.name: Great Sage
entries: Your mind is fully attuned with your magic, granting you the following benefits:

items.name: Deep Concentration
items.entry: Before you take damage you can choose to add your proficiency bonus to a saving throw to maintain concentration that you make as a result of that damage. If you do and fail, you cannot use this again until you finish a short rest.

items.name: Vast Memory
items.entry: Learn a number of level 1+ spells equal to your proficiency bonus. They must be spells you can already learn from your spellcasting features. You can replace one of the spells with a different one whenever you level up.

items.name: Large
items.entry: Your are one size larger and the weight of your body is multiplied by 4.

items.name: Small
items.entry: You are one size smaller and the weight of your body is divided by 4

items.name: Dart
items.entry: Once when you take the dash action you can increase your movement speed by 10 ft until the start of your next turn. You regain this ability at the start of your next turn.

items.name: Crowded
items.entry: You can occupy the space of other creatures (no more than one at a time).

feat.name: Crafter
entries: You are adept at crafting things and bargaining with merchants, granting you the following benefits:

items.name: Tool Proficiency
items.entry: You gain proficiency in an Artisan's Tool of your choice.

items.name: Slapdash
items.entry: When you make or help with a crafting check you can divide the time spent modifier by 2. If you do, you cannot do so again until after a short rest.

items.name: Recycle
items.entry: When you fail a crafting check there is a 10% chance that your materials are not negatively affected.

feat.name: Muscician
entries: You grant the following benefits

items.name: Instrument Training
items.entry: You gain proficiency in a Musical Instrument of your choice.

items.name: Inspiring Song
items.entry: As you finish a Long Rest or short rest, you can play a song on a Musical Instrument with which you have Tool Proficiency and give Inspiration to allies who hear the song and do not have any inspiration. The number of allies you can affect in this way equals your Proficiency Bonus.

feat.name: Fighting Initiate
entries: Gain a Fighting Style feat of your choice. It must be one you don't already have, the one you choose must be different.

feat.name: Archery
entries: You gain a +1 bonus to attack rolls you make with ranged weapons.

feat.name: Interception
entries: Once you can use the reaction of your shield without expending your reaction. It must be a reaction you haven't used this turn and you cannot use this reaction again this turn. You regain this ability after a long rest.

feat.name: Protection
entries: Choose a reaction that is found on a basic shield when you gain this feat. While holding any type of shield you can use that reaction a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus and regain all uses on a long rest.

feat.name: Superior Technique
entries: You learn one maneuver of your choice from the fighter class. If a maneuver you use requires your target to make a saving throw to resist the maneuver's effects, the saving throw DC equals 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength or Dexterity modifier (your choice.)

You gain one Stratagem die, which is a d6 (this die is added to any Stratagem dice you have from another source). This die is used to fuel your maneuvers. A Superiority die is expended when you use it. You regain your expended Superiority dice when you finish a short or long rest.

feat.name: Cantrip Fighting
entries: Choose a class. You learn 2 cantrips of your choice from that class's spell list. Use that class's spellcasting ability and spellcasting focus for these spells. Whenever you gain a level you can replace one of these cantrips.

feat.name: Mastered Fighting

prerequisite.note: When Gaining the Level 2 Fighter "Fighting Style" Feature

entries: Learn 2 masteries. Whenever you gain a level you can replace one of these masteries.

prerequisite.other: No higher than 1st-level or you're blind

items.name: Blinded
items.entry: You are blind, but you have 120 ft of tremorsense

items.name: Heighten Senses
items.entry: As a bonus action you can gain advantage on perception checks for one minute. You can do this a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus and regain all uses on a long rest.

items.name: Voice Lock
items.entry: As an action you can force a creature you see to make a charisma saving throw. For the next ten minutes, whenever you're sensing the target with your tremorsense you can hear what it's saying. You regain this ability after a long rest.

feat.name: Amputee
feat.repeatableNote: Yes, but you must choose a different hand each time.

prerequisite.other: No higher than 1st level unless one of your hands is unusable and not already affected by this feat

items.name: Unusuable
items.entry: You lose the use of one of your hands. Nothing changes if the hand is already unusuable. This might come in the form of a missing arm, missing hand, nerve damaged, etc.

items.name: Presthetique
items.entry: As an action you can attach up to 1 item to the hand you can't use. It counts as holding that item. As an action you can detach it. It cannot be forcibly removed while you're conscious unless you are willing.

items.name: Fancy Feet
items.entry: As a reaction to a creature missing an attack roll against you, you can move up to half your movement speed in a straight line without provoking opportunity attacks. You can do this a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus and regain all uses on a long rest.

items.name: Repeatable
items.entry: You can take this feat more than once, but you must choose a different hand each time for unusable.

feat.name: Patient Disciple
entries: You gain the following benefits:

items.name: Clash
items.entry: If you make an attack roll with a versatile weapon against a target immediately when it would hit with an attack roll or would be hit by an attack roll, you can choose to clash. If your attack roll is higher than the opposing attack roll, then the opposing attack misses. Additionally, you can choose to make your attack miss the target.

items.name: Patience
items.entry: If you spend your reaction to use a held action, regain your expended reaction.

items.name: Tools
items.entry: Gain proficiency in two tools.

items.name: Ease of Use
items.entry: You can make an ability check with one of these tools without holding it as long as it is on your person.

items.name: Masteries
items.entry: Gain 2 masteries. Whenever you gain a level you can swap one of these masteries with a different mastery.

items.name: Repeatable
items.entry: You can take this feat more than once.

items.name: Tools
items.entry: Gain proficiency in two tools that are not alliances.

items.name: Mechanical Focus
items.entry: You can use those tools as spell focuses.

items.name: Two Cantrips
items.entry: Learn two cantrips from a class of your choice. Your spellcasting ability for these cantrips is the spellcasting ability of that class. You can replace these cantrips whenever you gain a level.

items.name: Repeatable
items.entry: You can take this feat more than once.

items.name: Extra Opportunity Attack
items.entry: You can attack twice, instead of once, when you make an opportunity attack.

items.name: Somatic Components
items.entry: You can perform the Somatic Components of a spell with a hand that is holding a shield.

items.name: Protect Concentration
items.entry: If you receive a bonus to your AC from your shield or cover against an effect and that effect causes you to make a saving throw to maintain concentration, add those AC bonuses to the saving throw.

feat.name: Dual Shielder
entries: You gain the following features.

items.name: Twin Shield
items.entry: You can benefit from up to two shields at the same time.

items.name: Weaponized Defenses
items.entry: While wielding a shield, you can use 1d6 as the damage die for your unarmed strikes and your opportunity attacks can be unarmed strikes even if you don't have an empty hand.

items.name: Dual Don
items.entry: You can don or doff two shields when you normally would don or doff one.

feat.name: Eldritch Adept
entries: You gain the following features.

items.name: Invocation
items.entry: You learn one Eldritch Invocation option of your choice from the warlock class. Your spellcasting ability for any spells granted by this invocation is the ability you increased with this feat. If the invocation has a prerequisite of any kind, you can choose that invocation only if you meet the prerequisite. If the prerequisite states that you must be atleast a level 2 warlock, ignore that requirement. Whenever you gain a level, you can replace the invocation with another one from the warlock class.

items.name: Impenetrable
items.entry: When you use a reaction granted by a shield you can regain your expended reaction. If you do, you cannot do so again until the start of your next turn. It must be a reaction you haven't used this turn and you cannot use it again this turn.

items.name: Swap
items.entry: When you would normally draw or stow a weapon, you can instead swap (stow then draw) one shield you're holding with another shield on your person.

items.name: Windstep
items.entry: Once you can jump without a surface to push off of as long as you are held aloft or have a reduced fall speed. You regain this ability at the start of your next turn.

items.name: Feather Fall
items.entry: You know the Feather Fall spell and can cast it once without expending a spell slot. You regain this ability after a short rest.

items.name: Launch
items.entry: As a reaction to getting pushed or pulled you can double the distance that it pushes or pulls you.

items.name: Repeatable
items.entry: You can take this feat more than once.

items.name: Propel
items.entry: As a bonus action you can double your Fly, Glide or Hover speed until the end of your next turn. You can do this a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus and regain all uses after a long rest.

items.name: Crash Landing
items.entry: Once as a reaction before you take damage from falling you can reduce the damage by a number of d6s equal to half your level. You regain this ability after a short rest.

items.name: Repeatable
items.entry: You can take this feat more than once.

feat.name: Mind Over Matter
feat.repeatableNote: Yes, but you must choose the other option for ignore pain

items.name: Ignore Pain
items.entry: Choose one of the following:
Whenever you would make a constitution saving throw to maintain concentration, make a wisdom saving throw instead.
Use wisdom instead of constitution for maximum hit points and rolling hit dice.

items.name: Ignore Death
items.entry: Once as a bonus action you can ignore all of the negative effects of having zero or less hit points (including death saving throws) for 5 rounds which conclude at the start of your turn. Rounds where you do not spend any movement do not count towards the duration of the effect. You regain this ability after a long rest.

items.name: Repeatable
items.entry: You can take this one additional time, but if you do you must pick the other option for ignore pain.

feat.name: Lifesaver
feat.repeatableNote: Yes, but you must choose the other option for miraculous recovery

items.name: Emergency Attention
items.entry: Immediately before you take the help action to attempt to stabilize a creature you can halve the creature's negative hit points (The hit points must be less than zero). You can use this a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus and regain all uses on a long rest.

items.name: Miraculous Recovery
items.entry: For every healing die that rolls the highest number it can roll, add a die of that type. This only applies when you are healed or when you heal a creature other than you (choose when you gain this feat).

items.name: Hazardous Distraction
items.entry: As a reaction immediately before a creature you can see within a distance equal to a third of your movement speed is affected by a harmful area of effect you can move up to a third of your movement speed straight towards them. If you end your movement in the area of effect, you can make an opportunity attack with a melee weapon against them.

items.name: Avoid Hazard
items.entry: When you take the dodge action you can gain immunity to a damage type of your choice until the end of your next turn. You can do this a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus and regain all uses after a long rest.

items.name: Run Away
items.entry: When you use the Take Cover reaction you can move three times as far and until the end of the turn you can apply the bonus granted to you by cover to any saving throw you make.

items.name: Keep Safe
items.entry: When you take the dodge action until the end of your next turn creatures other than you that you can touch have advantage on dexterity saving throws and attack rolls against them have disadvantage.

items.name: Chosen Chemicals
items.entry: Choose Poison damage or Acid damage.

items.name: Adjust for Species
items.entry: Once at any time you can pick a creature type. Until the start of your next turn, damage you deal of the chosen type to creatures of the type you picked ignores resistance and immunity. Additionally, if any of the damage dice roll their highest value add an additional damage die. It is the same damage type and die type. Additional dice can be added in this way no more than a number of times equal to twice the ability modifier increased by this feat to each instance of damage. You can do this a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus and regain all uses on a long rest.

items.name: Proficiency
items.entry: You gain proficiency in one tool of your choice.

items.name: Expertise
items.entry: Gain expertise in a tool offered by the class that granted you this feat. If you were proficient in that tool, gain proficiency in a tool of your choice.

items.name: Repeatable
items.entry: You can take this feat more than once.

items.name: 1st-level feat
items.entry: Gain a first level feat.

items.name: Concealed Weapon
items.entry: Attacking with a light weapon does not reveal you from hiding.

items.name: Offhand Punch
items.entry: Once when you make an unarmed strike you can treat it as a light weapon. You regain this ability at the start of your next turn.

items.name: Bleed
items.entry: Once when you hit with a light weapon you can make the target bleed. If you do, they take damage equal to your proficiency bonus at the end of each of their turns until they use their action to stop it. You regain this ability after a long rest.

items.name: Repeatable
items.entry: You can take this feat more than once.

items.name: Toss
items.entry: When you take the attack action you can spend one of its attacks to use a consumable that would normally take an action to use. If you do, you cannot do so again until the start of your next turn. You can do this a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus and regain all uses after a long rest.

items.name: Fuse
items.entry: As an action you can attach a consumable to a surface. Choose a number of rounds up to a minute, concluding at the end of your turn. It must be a consumable that takes an action to use. When someone steps on the 5ft square of surface it's attached to or the fuse's duration has passed, the item is used. The effect is centered on the space adjacent to the surface it was attached to.

items.name: At the ready
items.entry: You can draw or stow a consumable that takes an action to use when you would normally draw or stow a weapon.
